result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Adam J Brownell in court with Attorney Patrick Cavanaugh Brennan.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #14CF1356.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing at 01-21-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Adam J Brownell in court with attorney Patrick Cavanaugh Brennan.  Special Prosecutor Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Brennan states that the parties are still trying to resolve both cases and requests that the jury status be adjourned. The State also requests adjournment of jury trial due to witness unavailability. Court will adjourn.14CF1356 to be reset for jury trial, 15CF85 to follow. Court addresses WCS letter. Parties may request a plea and sentencing hearing if case resolves.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
